alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:06PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sequatchie and southwestern Bledsoe Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1206 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dunlap, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dunlap, Palio, Cagle, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Flat Top Mountain and Mowbray Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
